inventions.name: Fire
inventions.description: First controlled use of fire by early humans

inventions.name: Printing Press
inventions.dismissalQuote: Too many books will make men less studious
inventions.impact: Enabled the spread of knowledge, sparked the Renaissance and Reformation. Over 8 million books exist today.
inventions.funFact: The Catholic Church initially banned many printed books, creating the Index of Forbidden Books in 1559.

inventions.name: Steam Engine
inventions.dismissalQuote: Rail travel at high speed is not possible because passengers would die of asphyxia
inventions.dismissedBy: Dr. Dionysius Lardner, professor of Natural Philosophy
inventions.impact: Powered the Industrial Revolution. Modern freight trains can exceed 100 mph safely.
inventions.funFact: The first passenger railway death was not from speed but from a person being hit by a locomotive at the track opening ceremony.

inventions.name: Telephone
inventions.dismissalQuote: This 'telephone' has too many shortcomings to be seriously considered as a means of communication
inventions.impact: Over 8 billion mobile subscriptions worldwide today. Connected the entire planet.
inventions.funFact: Western Union rejected buying the telephone patent for $100,000. That patent would be worth trillions today.

inventions.name: Electric Light
inventions.dismissalQuote: Everyone acquainted with the subject will recognize it as a conspicuous failure
inventions.dismissedBy: Henry Morton, President of the Stevens Institute of Technology
inventions.impact: Changed human civilization - enabling 24-hour productivity and fundamentally altering sleep patterns.
inventions.funFact: Edison tested over 3,000 materials before finding the right filament. Persistence pays off!

inventions.name: Airplane
inventions.dismissedBy: Lord Kelvin, President of the Royal Society
inventions.impact: Over 100,000 flights daily. Changed travel, commerce, and warfare forever.
inventions.funFact: The Wright Brothers' first flight was shorter than the wingspan of a Boeing 747.

inventions.name: Penicillin
inventions.dismissalQuote: Fleming's discovery was a laboratory curiosity with no practical application
inventions.dismissedBy: Medical establishment (Fleming couldn't get funding for years)
inventions.impact: Saved over 200 million lives. First true antibiotic revolutionized medicine.
inventions.funFact: Fleming discovered penicillin by accident when mold contaminated his bacterial cultures while he was on vacation.

inventions.name: Pap Smear
inventions.dismissalQuote: A waste of time - cervical cancer screening is unnecessary and invasive
inventions.impact: Prevents over 250,000 cervical cancer deaths per year. Reduced mortality by 70%.
inventions.funFact: Dr. Papanicolaou spent 21 years perfecting the test before it was accepted. It's now standard healthcare worldwide.

inventions.name: Personal Computer
inventions.dismissalQuote: There is no reason anyone would want a computer in their home
inventions.dismissedBy: Ken Olsen, founder of Digital Equipment Corporation
inventions.impact: Over 2 billion PCs in use today. Transformed work, education, and entertainment globally.
inventions.funFact: The first Apple II cost $1,298 in 1977 ($6,500 in today's money). Today's smartphones have 100,000x more computing power.

inventions.name: Internet
inventions.dismissalQuote: The Internet will go spectacularly supernova and in 1996 catastrophically collapse
inventions.impact: 5+ billion users worldwide. Fundamentally changed human communication and commerce.
inventions.funFact: Metcalfe later blended a printed copy of his prediction and ate it at a conference to admit he was wrong.

inventions.name: iPhone
inventions.dismissalQuote: There's no chance that the iPhone is going to get any significant market share
inventions.impact: Over 6 billion smartphone users today. Redefined mobile computing and communication.
inventions.funFact: Ballmer laughed at the iPhone's $600 price and lack of keyboard. Apple now sells $200B+ worth of iPhones annually.

inventions.name: Artificial Intelligence
inventions.dismissalQuote: AI is just autocomplete on steroids - it will never be truly useful
inventions.impact: ChatGPT reached 100M users in 2 months. AI is transforming every industry from healthcare to creative work.
inventions.funFact: ChatGPT became the fastest-growing consumer application in history, surpassing TikTok and Instagram's early growth.
